result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven R Krueger was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Steven R Krueger is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Steven R Krueger was found guilty of Exposing genitals to a child, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.10(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: 6 month periodic review.  Maintain full time employment or school.
May apply for expungment after 3 years if no new law vilations, sentence fully satisfied and fine paid in full.

ADA Troy Cross appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant appeared in person with Atty Charles Giesen.  Rights/elements in 14CF192. Waiver of Right to Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found, bound over.  Information filed.  Counts 1 and 2 dismissed in 14CF192.  No contest plea to Ct 3, court withheld sentence and placed defendant on 3 years probation.  $1000 restitution from 13CM370. 10 days jail with huber beginning 10-11-14 @ 7 pm.  $250 DNA sample/surcharge.  Maintain full time employment or school.  May apply for expungment after 3 years if no new law violations, sentence fully satisfied and fine paid in full. No jail credit.  6 month periodic review.  In 13CM370, case dismissed/read in for restitution in 14CF192.

Defendant Steven R Krueger in court with attorney Charles W Giesen.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Giesen requesting new return date, 13 CM 370 to track, bond cont'd  Hearing scheduled for September 11, 2014 at 02:45 pm.

Defendant, Steven R Krueger, appeared. Jordan Lippert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  $5000.00 signature bond.  No contact with KLM.  Not to have any unsupervised contact with any juveniles under the age of 18.  Standard felony conditions.  Waives time limits.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 16, 2014 at 01:10 pm.  Hearing scheduled for July 18, 2014 at 02:45 pm.
